title: North Korea Fires Suspected Missile After Warning US on Military Drills
description: North Korea fired a suspected ballistic missile Tuesday toward waters off its east coast, South Korea’s Joint Chiefs of Staff said in a text message to reporters.

title: Buttigieg Pushes New Crackdown on Mergers in Transportation Industry
description: US regulators are engaging in a “real shift” in how they view competition in transportation industries and will make “vigorous” use of their authority to ensure airlines, railroads and others serve consumers, Secretary Pete Buttigieg said Monday.

title: Buttigieg Backs Stricter Train Safety Rules After Toxic Ohio Derailment
description: US Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg urged lawmakers to move quickly to tighten rules for freight railroads, saying he’s “encouraged” by a bipartisan push in Congress in the wake of last month’s toxic wreck in Ohio.

title: How Military Has a Thumb on Scales in Thai Election
description: Thailand is heading into a general election — the second since a 2014 putsch — with a group of ex-generals and their associated parties seeking to extend their nearly a decade-long reign. The former coup leaders have a clear head start before even a single vote is cast, as they enjoy the support of their handpicked Senate, which plays a big role in determining the next prime minister. Still, voters are unhappy about the soaring cost of living and record household debt in the wake of the Covid-19

title: McConnell Released From Hospital and Will Begin Rehabilitation
description: Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell has been discharged from a Washington-area hospital after undergoing treatment for a concussion suffered last week, but he will continue inpatient care at a rehabilitation facility before returning home, his spokesman said.

title: Senior Tories Cast Doubt on Sunak’s Plan For Migrants Crossing English Channel
description: Senior MPs in Rishi Sunak’s ruling Conservative Party cast doubt on his plan to stop migrants crossing the English Channel in small boats and warned it faces numerous amendments before becoming law.

title: Trump Views DeSantis as Strongest Challenger for 2024 Nomination
description: Former President Donald Trump said he considers Florida Governor Ron DeSantis as his strongest potential challenger for the 2024 Republican nomination.

title: US and Allies Unveil Submarine Deal to Counter China in Pacific
description: The leaders of the US, the UK and Australia met Monday in San Diego to unveil a plan for a new fleet of nuclear-powered submarines that will ply the Pacific in an effort to blunt China’s growing and so-far unchallenged assertiveness in the South China Sea and beyond.

title: Germany, Brazil Plan High-Level Meetings as Ties Strengthen
description: Brazil’s President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, right, greets Germany’s Chancellor Olaf Scholz in Brasilia on Jan. 30, 2023.

title: Biden Expected to Have Call With China’s Xi Jinping But No Date Set
description: President Joe Biden plans to hold a phone call with his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, once the legislature concludes its annual gathering and the government in Beijing returns to work, National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan said.

title: Fed’s Oversight of SVB Questioned After Bank’s Sudden Failure
description: The Federal Reserve’s oversight of SVB Financial Group is drawing fire after the bank’s sudden collapse, which led to several emergency measures from US regulators, including central bank liquidity programs to stanch instability across small lenders.

title: China Is Set to Resume Issuing Visas as It Emerges From Covid Zero
description: China will resume the issuance of all types of visas for foreigners starting on March 15, the embassy in the US said, another step in the country’s emergence from strict “Covid Zero” controls.

title: AMLO Claims Mexico Is Safer Than the US, Citing Cancun’s Tourism Boom
description: Mexico’s tourism boom is proof the country is safe to travel, President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said in an attempt to give reassurances after the kidnapping of four Americans set off calls by US lawmakers to crack down on drug cartels.

title: EU Plans Virtual Regional Electricity Hubs in Market Reform
description: The European Union plans to propose virtual regional electricity hubs as part of an overhaul of its power market to prevent extreme energy price swings that hurt businesses and consumers.

title: New York Risks Billions in Extra Costs If Fewer Leave Medicaid
description: New York State faces billions of dollars in additional costs over the next two years if fewer people than expected leave its public insurance rolls once it resumes screening residents for eligibility.

title: Germany Seeks to Deepen Cooperation With Brazil on Hydrogen
description: Robert Habeck, Germany's economy and climate minister, speaks during a news conference in Berlin, Germany, on Wednesday, April 6, 2022. Habeck said it would be "a logical step" to back up the political decision to reduce Russian coal dependency by including a Russian coal import embargo in a European Union sanctions package "at some point".

title: Italy Wants NATO to Help Combat Russia-Driven Migrant Influx
description: Italy’s defense minister on Monday called for help from NATO and the European Union to help deal with a new influx of migrants from north Africa he said has been sparked by Russian meddling in the region.

title: UK Calls China an ‘Epoch-Defining Challenge’ to Global Security
description: China poses significant risks to global prosperity and security, UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said, describing the country’s economic and military rise as an “an epoch-defining challenge” to international order.

title: Key GOP Trade Lawmaker Urges Biden to Seek Tariff-Cutting Deals
description: President Joe Biden should rekindle talks on free-trade agreements started by his predecessor to create opportunities for American companies and advance priorities including labor and environment rules, a top House Republican on trade said.

title: Trump Probe 'Weaponized' by Manhattan DA, Lawyer Says in Calling for Review
description: A lawyer for Donald Trump has called for an independent review of the Manhattan district attorney’s office over its years-long investigation of the former president, claiming prosecutors there have “weaponized” the office.

title: Rescue of Signature Bank Is ‘Not a Bailout,’ New York Governor Hochul Says
description: New York Governor Kathy Hochul said the takeover of Signature Bank by federal regulators on Sunday “was not a bailout” that puts state taxpayers at risk.

title: DeSantis and Trump See Schools as the Path to 2024 Nomination
description: The minute details of a third-grader’s daily lessons are becoming a new battleground in Republican intra-party politics, with potential challenger Ron DeSantis touting his efforts to transform education in Florida and Donald Trump rushing to catch up.

title: EU Struggles to Find Way to Deliver Ukraine Ammunition Rapidly
description: The European Union is struggling to figure out a way to fill Ukraine’s immediate ammunition needs even though member states have already agreed politically to support Kyiv with additional shells.

title: Biden Backs $8 Billion Alaska Oil Project Despite Climate Peril
description: President Joe Biden authorized a giant ConocoPhillips oil project in northwest Alaska that environmentalists argue has no place in a warming world, even as he sought to bar future drilling across US Arctic waters and lands.

title: Biden Vows to Hold Banks Accountable, Urges Stronger Rules
description: President Joe Biden sought to reassure jittery consumers and markets the US financial system is on solid footing, promising to hold those responsible for the collapse of two banks and saying he would urge Congress to strengthen regulation of the banking system.

title: English Cats to Be Protected by Compulsory Microchips From 2024
description: Cat owners in England will have to microchip their pets from next year as the government seeks to deter thefts and reunite strays with their owners.

title: Russian Oil Flows Rebound as India Snaps Up More Pacific Cargoes
description: Indian refiners are buying increasing volumes of Russia’s key ESPO crude grade, shipped from its Pacific coast

title: Erdogan Looks to Islamic Fringe to Bolster Electoral Alliance
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is seeking the support of smaller, fringe Islamist parties in upcoming elections, widening his conservative base and risking cultural clashes over religion and women’s rights with the secular-minded opposition.

title: Competition From the US Is Forcing Europe to Up Its Green Game
description: A newly muscular American approach is forcing the European Union to get savvier about the business side of its climate strategy.

title: Russia Remains India’s Main Arms Supplier But Imports Dip Sharply
description: Russia remains India’s main source of weapons even as the nation has drastically trimmed purchases, highlighting the challenge for Prime Minister Narendra Modi of recalibrating New Delhi’s dependence on Moscow, while its borders with both China and Pakistan remain tense.

title: What Role Did China Play in Brokering Iran-Saudi Detente: Q&A
description: The detente between Tehran and Riyadh last week was all the more surprising because of the third party serving as mediator: China.

title: Iran’s Judiciary Says It Pardoned 22,000 Jailed Protesters
description: Iran’s judiciary said it pardoned some 22,000 people arrested in widespread anti-government protests that erupted last September.

title: SVB Failure Exposes California’s Dire Reality
description: California has a reputation for setting global cultural and political trends, but the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank shines an unflattering light on the Golden State, which has an economy similar in size to Germany.

title: Buoyed by Saudi Deal, Iran Seeks to Mend Other Regional Ties
description: Iran said it welcomes any diplomatic effort to improve relations with its Gulf neighbors and wants to repair ties with more Arab countries following last week’s accord with Saudi Arabia.

title: SVB Failure Sparks Blame Game Over Trump-Era Regulatory Rollback
description: Eight years ago, Greg Becker delivered a blunt message to lawmakers in Washington: the bank he ran was not like Wall Street.

title: Xi May Visit Russia as Early as Next Week, Reuters Reports
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping may visit Moscow as early as next week, Reuters reported, showing his close ties with Russian leader Vladimir Putin even as Beijing seeks to portray itself as a broker for peace in Ukraine.

title: Bali Tourists Banned From Riding Motorbikes After Bad Behavior
description: Bali has had enough of unruly riders. Foreign tourists won’t be allowed to use motorcycles to get around the island after a string of accidents led to injuries and even deaths.

title: Taiwan Blasts EU for Wanting Chips While Denying Trade Talks
description: The European Union may not get a chip plant from Taiwanese companies if it continues to refuse to engage Taipei in trade talks, the government-backed Central News Agency said in an editorial column on Monday.

title: Taiwan Seeks Details on Soldier’s Possible Defection to China
description: Taiwan is seeking information from China about a soldier who went missing from an island outpost and turned up on the mainland, in a case that Taipei acknowledged could be a possible defection.

title: Rio Tinto Digs Deep as Prized $7 Billion Copper Mine Finally Delivers
description: Rio Tinto Group has begun digging copper from the underground portion of its prized mine in Mongolia — an expansion that will turn the operation into one of the world’s largest — after years of delays, cost blow-outs and billion-dollar disputes with the country’s government.

title: Ukraine Latest: NATO Is Vying for Greater Control of the Arctic
description: NATO forces are gathered in Norway for joint drills as the defense alliance — along with Russia, China and others — are vying for greater control of the Arctic.

title: Putin to Meet Business Tycoons For First Time Since Start of War
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin plans to meet top business leaders in the Kremlin this week for the first time since he launched the invasion of Ukraine, according to people familiar with the preparations.

title: China’s New Premier Strikes Conciliatory Tone on Ties With US
description: New Chinese Premier Li Qiang touted trade ties with the US and questioned the need for decoupling, a sign that Beijing may be trying to put a floor under simmering tensions with Washington.

title: New Zealand’s Hipkins Resurrects Labour After Ardern Exit, Poll Shows
description: New Zealand Prime Minister Chris Hipkins has resurrected his Labour Party’s chances of winning a third term in office after replacing Jacinda Ardern, the latest opinion poll shows.

title: The Arctic Is the New Spot for NATO and Russia to Flex Their Military Muscle
description: Moscow houses nuclear submarines in the region, which is set to increase in strategic importance for major powers including the US and China.

title: Imran Khan May Skip Court Hearing, Adding to Pakistan Turmoil
description: Pakistan’s former premier Imran Khan is seeking permission from the High Court to skip a hearing where he would have been formally charged for selling state gifts when he was in power.

title: US Backstops Bank Deposits to Avert Crisis After SVB Collapse: What's Next?
description: US regulators are moving swiftly to assure depositors their money is safe following the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank. Bloomberg's Shery Ahn explains the latest from the fallout. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: China’s Premier Downplays GDP Growth, Courts Private Firms
description: China will protect the rights of entrepreneurs and continue to support private businesses, Premier Li Qiang said in his first public comments since taking office, while also downplaying the importance of the economic growth rate.

title: Xi Tells Priorities as New Term Starts, Li to Speak: NPC Update
description: China must redouble efforts to ensure stability and bolstering self-reliance, President Xi Jinping told lawmakers in a speech to mark the start of his precedent-breaking third term.  He also vowed to oppose foreign interference on Taiwan, a veiled reference to increasing American support for the democratically elected government in Taipei.

title: Xi Urges Focus on China’s Stability at Start of Third Term
description: China must redouble efforts to ensure stability and bolstering self-reliance, President Xi Jinping told lawmakers in a speech to mark the start of his precedent-breaking third term.

title: Malaysia Ex-PM Muhyiddin Charged with Money Laundering: Bernama
description: A Malaysian court charged former Malaysian Prime Minister Muhyiddin Yassin with money laundering, the seventh criminal charge the opposition leader faces just four months after losing in the general election.

title: China Slams US for Expanding Military Access in Philippines
description: China hit back at the US for expanding military access in the Philippines, saying Washington was trying to “encircle and contain” Beijing, and is “driving a wedge” between the two Asian nations.

title: US, Allies Prepare Mega Submarine Deal Under Aukus Agreement
description: The leaders of the US, Australia and the UK will announce plans for a new fleet of nuclear-powered submarines Monday as they deepen the Aukus defense partnership aimed at countering China in the Pacific. Upgrading Australia’s aging sub fleet is a lynchpin of that effort.

title: Biden Says Those Behind SVB Bank ‘Mess’ Will Be Held Accountable
description: President Joe Biden said that he ordered the Treasury Department and his economic advisers to address the failures of Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank, adding that those responsible will be held accountable.

title: NHS Heads Into Week of Danger With 72-Hour Junior Doctors Strike
description: Junior doctors in the UK’s National Health Service will strike for 72 hours starting Monday, with officials warning of the worst disruption since the latest action began.

title: UK Carmakers Warn US, EU Green Deals Threaten Domestic Industry
description: UK carmakers warned that without significant government backing, the industry won’t be able to compete with the US and the European Union, which are offering unprecedented incentives for electric-vehicle production.

title: China Bulls See Xi-Putin Ties as Top Wildcard Risk
description: China’s relationship with Russia and the potential role it might play in the war in Ukraine are the biggest wild-card risks to markets that investors are missing, according to the latest MLIV Pulse survey.
